newsitem.title: UK: INSTANT VIEW - British budget tax proposals.
newsitem.headline: INSTANT VIEW - British budget tax proposals.

text.p: Following is a selection of political reactions to Chancellor of the Exchequer Kenneth Clarke's tax proposals in his 1996 annual budget statement.
Personal and company tax changes will come into effect in April 1997 while some other tax and duty changes will be effective immediately.
GERARD LYONS, CHIEF ECONOMIST AT DBK INTERNATIONAL

"On borrowing, he's obviously playing a very cautious stance. He's saying he's going to cut seven billion sterling over the next three years. Remember last year he announced seven and a half billion cuts over a three-year period.

"So this budget's probably going to be pretty much like last year's budget and in terms of tax giveaway, we should be looking probably still for about a three billion net giveaway at the end of the day."
